name: Danish Pruthi
content: Danish Pruthi | Danish Pruthi Danish Danish Pruthi Assistant Professor Computational and Data Sciences (CDS) Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore Office: CDS 401 (see directions) Google Scholar | Twitter Email (Please read this before emailing) Hey! I am Danish Pruthi, I am an assistant professor at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore. At IISc, I guide an NLP group, and am currently interested in: Detecting AI-generated content, and broadly, curbing unhealthy reliance on AI, Measuring and improving geo-cultural representation in AI, Evaluating large language models, with an emphasis to enable responsible use. I received my PhD from CMU, where I was co-advised by Zachary C. Lipton and Graham Neubig. My doctoral research focused on addressing issues concerning the interpretability of deep learning models. I completed my bachelors degree in computer science from BITS Pilani, Pilani in 2015. I've also spent time doing research at Google AI, Microsoft Research, Facebook AI Research, and Amazon AI. I am a recipient of the Schmidt Sciences AI2050 Early Career Fellowship, Siebel Scholarship and the CMU Presidential Fellowship. Until recently, my legal name was only Danish—an “edge case” for many deployed NLP systems, leading to airport quagmires and, in equal parts, funny anecdotes. I enjoy traveling and have lived (3+ months) in New York City, Bangalore, Pittsburgh, Mountain View, Pilani and Hisar. News & Activities [New] Our work on uncovering plagiarism in AI-generated research received the outstanding paper award at ACL 2025. Speaking at a Pre-ACL workshop in Copenhagen in July 2025. Delivering a talk at VLMs4All workshop at CVPR 2025 in Nashville. Upcoming ACL 2025 (main) papers: determining plagiarism in AI-generated research; auditing moderation policies at Twitch; and evaluating fairness in Indian contexts. Our work on watermarking content is now accepted to ICML. Dec 2024: Delivered a talk at IIT Madras and IIT Jodhpur. Nov 2024: Delivered a keynote talk at WiNLP workshop at EMNLP 2024.
